job_details: Job DetailsAdditional Information Shift Supervisor leading the team during event set up and take down.Job Number 23023489Job Category Food and Beverage & CulinaryLocation Oakland Marriott City Center, 1001 Broadway, Oakland, California, United States VIEW ON MAPSchedule Full-TimeLocated Remotely? NRelocation? NPosition Type Non-Management JOB SUMMARY   Ensure staff is working together as a team. Inspect grooming and attire of staff and rectify any deficiencies. Communicate with guests, other employees, or departments to ensure guest needs are met. Respond to and try to fulfill any special banquet event arrangements. Set up banquet area/room, ensuring cleanliness and proper set up of furniture/equipment. Inspect and maintain table set-ups for cleanliness, neatness and agreement with group requirements and company standards, and resolve any problems. Document pertinent information in appropriate department logbook.   Assist management in hiring, training, scheduling, evaluating, counseling, disciplining, and motivating and coaching employees. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others, and support team to reach common goals. Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; and complete safety training and certifications. Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional, maintain confidentiality of proprietary information, and protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards, anticipate and address guests’ service needs, assist individuals with disabilities, and thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language, and answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats (e.g., small print). Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time or for an entire work shift. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance and objects weighing in excess of 75 pounds with assistance. Grasp, turn, and manipulate objects of varying size and weight, requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination. Move over sloping, uneven, or slippery surfaces as well as up and down stairs and/or service ramps. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested.           The pay range for this position is $26.05 to $26.05 per hour and offers health care benefits, flexible spending accounts, 401(k) plan, earned paid time off and/or sick leave, life insurance, disability coverage, and other life and work wellness benefits. Benefits may be subject to generally applicable eligibility, waiting period, contribution, and other requirements and conditions.  Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law. Marriott International considers for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Marriott International portfolio of brands includes both JW Marriott and Marriott Hotels.  Marriott Hotels, Marriott International’s flagship brand with more than 500 global locations, is advancing the art of hosting so that our guests can travel brilliantly. As a host with Marriott Hotels, you will help keep this promise by delivering premium choices, sophisticated style, and well-crafted details. With your skills and imagination, together we will innovate and reinvent the future of travel.      JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 80 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. JW believes our associates come first. Because if you’re happy, our guests will be happy. It’s as simple as that. Our hotels offer a work experience unlike any other, where you’ll be part of a community and enjoy a true camaraderie with a diverse group of co-workers. JW creates opportunities for training, development, recognition and most importantly, a place where you can really pursue your passions in a luxury environment. Treating guests exceptionally starts with the way we take care of our associates. That’s The JW Treatment™.

job_details:
Job Details
A respected group is opening a high-end concept in the bustling SOMA neighborhood and looking for skilled kitchen staff to join our team. We are a group of Michelin-level professionals creating one of the most unique seafood destinations in the state. Slated to open in mid-March, the space features a state of the art kitchen, expansive dining area, luxurious bar, and a busy private dining space.

We’re looking for several positions: Sous Chef, Chef de Partie, Line Cook, and Pastry Assistant at some of the best wages in the industry!

LINE COOK:
The base hourly pay rate for a Line Cook is $22/hour PLUS inclusion in the restaurant’s service charge allocations, which vary but can average for a total hourly compensation average of $30/hour or more.

The Line Cook position is responsible for daily prep and execution during service, reporting directly to the Chef de Partie and Sous Chef team. Hours are typically from 12pm or 1pm until close of service, including overtime as necessary.

SOUS CHEF
The salary range for the Sous Chef is $79,000-$85,000 annually plus sick pay, healthcare, and two weeks (minimum) paid time off.

The Sous Chef is responsible for supporting the Chef/Proprietor (Chef) and the Chef de Cuisine (CDC), and other superior managers, in successful kitchen operations, with excellent guest experience in quality food service as the core objective of the role.

The Sous Chef is in a leadership role that directly supports the structure and organization of the CDC and Chef, providing support in development and execution of the menu. As one of the key roles in the kitchen, the Sous Chef maintains high standards for the kitchen by providing discipline and structure, while maintaining a positive and optimistic attitude.

CHEF DE PARTIE
Starting pay for the Chef de Partie is up to $25/hour plus service charges, for a total compensation of $32/hour or more. Health benefits and sick leave are also included in the position.

The Chef de Partie position is responsible for high-level prep and execution during service, reporting directly to the Sous Chef team, Chef de Cuisine, and Chef/Owner. The Chef de Partie position can potentially be a guest-facing position, so excellent guest experience and quality food service is the core objective of the role.

PASTRY ASSISTANT
Starting pay for the Pastry Assistant is $23/hour plus service charges, for a total of $30/hour or more. Health benefits and sick leave are also included in the position.

The Pastry Assistant will be working under our fantastic Executive Pastry Chef, where skills in such as bread making, confectionary, artful plating, and ice cream/sorbet production are practiced. Hours worked are approximately from noon or 1pm until close, including overtime as necessary.

______

We are an excellent place to work! We offer some of the highest pay in the Bay Area as well as best-in-class benefits, including partially subsidized medical, dental, and vision coverage, sick pay, and generous paid holidays. We thrive on excellence and respect – our workplace culture is second-to-none and value hard work, collaboration, and creativity in a positive, uplifting work environment.

Ready to take your career to the next level? Send us your resume and let’s connect!

We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on any unlawful basis. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance we consider all qualified applicants regardless of arrest or conviction history.

Lazy Bear is looking for a full-time hospitality professional who is experienced in a fine dining environment. 
The person that fits this role has a passion for hospitality and a drive to improve themselves and their peers every day. They maintain a graceful and elegant presence throughout any fast-paced environment, and communicate effectively and magnanimously with co-workers and guests alike.

job_details: Job DetailsJob DescriptionIn the absence of the Head Chef, to assume complete responsibility for the overall kitchen operation as per the Head Chef Job Description. budgeted gross profit margins.To make certain the highest standard of food quality, presentation and service are achieved and maintained.To aid with all food orders ensuring that only approved job_details: Job DetailsJob DescriptionThe Executive Chef is a management position overseeing chef managers as well as hourly culinary staff, responsible for developing and executing culinary solutions to meet customer needs and tastes. Offers a wide variety of culinary solutions to meet customer and client needs and tastes. Oversees and manages culinary operations to meet production, presentation, and service standards. Applies culinary techniques to food preparation and manages the final presentation and service of food. COMPENSATION: The annual rate for this position ranges from $85,000.00 to $100,000.00, depending on circumstances including an applicant’s skills and qualifications, certain degrees and certifications, prior job experience, market data, and other relevant factors. Additional compensation may include a bonus or commission (if relevant). This is Aramark’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of compensation for this position as of the time of posting.Job ResponsibilitiesEnsures culinary production appropriately connects to the Executional Framework Ensures proper culinary standards and techniques are in place for preparation of food items, including production, presentation, and service standards Manages a culinary team, including chef managers and hourly staff, to ensure quality in final presentation of food Train and manage culinary and kitchen employees to use best practice food production techniques Coach employees by creating a shared understanding about what needs to be achieved and how it is to be achieved Reward and recognize employees Plan and execute team meetings and daily huddles Complete and maintain all staff records including training records, shift opening/closing checklists and performance data Develop and maintain effective client and guest rapport for mutually beneficial business relationships Interact directly with guests daily Aggregate and communicate regional culinary and ingredient trends Responsible for delivering food and labor targets Consistent focus on margin improvement; understanding performance metrics, data, order, and inventory trends Ensure efficient execution and delivery of all culinary products in line with the daily menu Maintain integrity of the standard Aramark food offer; responsible for always maintaining food quality and safety of items Full compliance with Operational Excellence fundamentals: managing waste, standard menus, recipes and ingredients through managing customer driven menus and labor standards Understand end to end supply chain and procurement process and systems, ensuring only authorized suppliers are used Full knowledge and implementation of the Food Framework Ensure accuracy of estimated food consumption for appropriate requisitions and/or food purchase Ensure proper equipment operation and maintenance Ensure compliance with Aramark SAFE food and Quality Assurance standards, occupational and environmental safety policies in all culinary and kitchen operations Comply with all applicable policies, rules and regulations, including but not limited to those relating to safety, health, wage and hour At Aramark, developing new skills and doing what it takes to get the job done make a positive impact for our employees and for our customers. In order to meet our commitments, job duties may change or new ones may be assigned without formal notice.   QualificationsRequires at least 4 years of culinary experience At least 2 years in a management role preferred  Requires a culinary degree or equivalent experience Ability to multi-task Ability to simplify the agenda for the team Requires advanced knowledge of the principles and practices within the food profession. This includes experiential knowledge required for management of people and/or problems.  Requires oral, reading, and written communication skills EducationAbout AramarkOur MissionRooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. job_details: Job DetailsMISTER JIU’S restaurant is seeking a SERVERMichelin starred restaurant, Mister Jiu's located historic San Francisco Chinatown is seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Server to join our team.At Mister Jiu’s, we celebrate the legacy of traditional Chinese recipes while embracing the California heritage of local and sustainable produce and pantry. This exciting, high intensity restaurant in the heart of San Francisco's Chinatown is aiming to create delicious food with a high level of precision, served in a relaxed, upscale atmosphere.We are seeking a spirited individual who is dedicated to fine dining service standards.  The ideal candidate thrives in a fast paced setting in an environment that promotes positive reinforcement. Server Qualifications:· -At least 3 years experience working in chef-driven restaurants. -Excellent people skills and the ability to remain calm under pressure.· -Ability to provide warm, professional & knowledgeable service in a high intensity work environment. -Must have a commitment to deliver a unique and memorable guest experience.  -A good understanding of Northern Californian produce.· -A deep understanding of wine, beers and spirits.  -Most importantly we are looking for people that love to learn and are team oriented.

job_details:
Job Details
McCall’s Catering and Events is hiring bussers at their Restaurants, Cafes and Coffee Shops. McCall’s is the one of San Francisco’s most noted caterers and operates five culinary-forward cafes in the city. If you enjoy a fast-pace way of working and want to kick start your career in the hospitality industry. We’d like to meet you.
We are looking for bussers to assist in preparing and serve hot and cold food & beverages, including various types of coffee and tea. To assist customers in a friendly and efficient manner. As well as to help support café staff members and set up and cleaning out of our dining areas.
Responsibilities:
- Greet all customers with professionalism; provide a positive customer experience with friendly and courteous service.
- Prepare dining areas before guests are seated
- Decorate tables with candles, napkins, linens and flowers
- Place tableware and condiments on tables
- Serve water and other condiments
- Refill beverages and take orders (where needed)
- Remove dirty utensils and replenish, as needed
- Provide special silverware sets to families with young children
- Clean and reset tables after guests leave
- Maintain health and safety regulations at all kitchen and dining areas
Requirements:
- Able to work in a fast-paced environment.
- Able to maintain a positive and professional attitude toward our guest.
- High volume experience on Café and restaurant.
- Customer service orientation; strong ability to multi task; retail, hospitality, and customer service experience preferred.
- Strong communication and time management skills.
- Honesty and integrity.
- Flexibility to work AM + PM shifts, including weekends, evenings, and holidays.
- Able to work in different location if needed.
- Understanding of hygiene and food safety Rules.
- Physical ability to lift 20 lbs. or more, and stand for long hours.
- Valid ABC-RBS certification
- CA Foodhandlers certification a plus.
Vaccination is a requirement of the job and accommodations due to disability or religious reasons will be evaluated in compliance with prevailing regulations.
If you want to working in an amazing company and start your career in the hospitality industry, please come and join our team.
comp_details: Compensation DetailsCompensation: Hourly ($17.00 - $19.00) plus tipsBenefits & Perks: Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, 401k

job_details: Job DetailsMarlena, a Michelin star restaurant in San Francisco, is looking for a qualified sous chef to join its team. You will work closely with chef David Fisher to achieve the restaurant's goals, and be EXPECTED to deliver on these tasks. We are a growing company, so benefits can be quite rewarding in the future, given great performance. Tasks include but are not limited to:-listening to/executing ALL TASKS presented by Chef David, Serena, or Exec sous-impeccable cooking ability-absolute precision and dedication to detail-ordering/respecting food costs, as well as cultivating great relationships within the Bay Area community-excellent organizational skills-a clear mind with proper intention-a team player that will do WHAT IT TAKES to help this team-schedulingBenefits:-health/dental plan after 60 days of employment-accrued vacation time-incredible work culture

job_details:
Job DetailsCotogna is the quintessential neighborhood spot featuring seasonally and daily changing Italian cuisine with house-made pasta, spit-roasted and grilled meat, wood-oven pizza, local seafood, and produce coming from the restaurant’s own farm. In keeping with Chef Michael Tusk’s cuisine, Cotogna showcases the best of Italian viticulture with an emphasis on organic, small scale wines true to their terroir.
WHAT WE OFFER YOU:

Consistent scheduling with 2 days off in a row
Competitive compensation


100% paid Medical, Dental, and Vision, 401K with up to 4.5% match
Deep retail-cost wine discounts, Cotogna Farmer’s Market & restaurant dining discount
Trips to our Fresh Run Farm in Marin and participation in our Employee Purchasing Program
Tax deferred commuter benefits for parking or public transportation
Personalized development plan, advancement opportunities, wine education curriculum
Sponsorship of continuing education classes in food and beverage
Supplemental relocation expenses possible and assisted housing search as needed

WHO YOU ARE:
A motivated, organized, charismatic individual. You are passionate about food and beverage, people and hospitality. A quick thinker who possesses the ability to simultaneously be creative and organized. Inherently hospitable, infinitely curious and KIND. You strike up a conversation with anyone, perform well under pressure and have an insatiable desire to learn. You want the opportunity to make your mark and contribute!
WHO WE ARE:

job_details: Job DetailsJob DescriptionDo you love to cook? Are you passionate about food? As a Cook on our team, you’ll help bring recipes to life while being able to flex your creativity! Surrounded by fresh ingredients and the best equipment, you’ll be immersed in a world that goes beyond food preparation – experimenting with different cuisines, flavors, and cooking styles. At Aramark, we care about your health, so we have production guidelines and safety procedures in place to help you do what you love. Get ready to reach new heights, ignite your passion, and pursue what matters by cooking with us!  COMPENSATION: The hourly rate of pay for this position is $22.10. This is Aramark’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the rate of compensation for this position as of the time of posting.Job Responsibilities•    Essential functions and responsibilities of the position may vary by Aramark location based on client requirements and business needs.    •    Cooks and prepare a variety of food according to production guidelines and standardized recipes  •    Sets up workstation with all needed ingredients and equipment •    Prepares ingredients by measuring, weighing, mixing, chopping, trimming, and peeling food items •    Safely uses a variety of utensils including knives •    Operates equipment such as ovens, stoves, slicers, mixers, etc. •    Bakes, roasts, broils, steams, and uses a variety of cooking methods on meat, vegetables, and other foods •    Arranges, garnishes, and portions food according to established guidelines  •    Properly stores food by adhering to food safety policies and procedures •    Cleans and sanitizes work areas, equipment, and utensils  •    Maintains excellent customer service and positive demeanor towards guests, customers, clients, co-workers, etc. •    Adheres to Aramark safety policies and procedures including accurate food safety and sanitation  •    Ensures security of company assets   At Aramark, developing new skills and doing what it takes to get the job done make a positive impact for our employees and for our customers. In order to meet our commitments, job duties may change or new ones may be assigned without formal notice.Qualifications•    Experience as a cook or in a related role required•    Validated knowledge of the basic principles of food preparation, various cooking methods, and food safety regulations such as accurate food handling, sanitation, and storage•    Must be able to acquire food safety certification•    Demonstrate basic math and counting skills•    Demonstrates interpersonal communication skills, both written and verbalThis role may have physical demands including, but not limited to, lifting, bending, pushing, pulling and/or extended walking and standing. This role may also require uniforms and/or usage of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).EducationAbout AramarkOur MissionRooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. job_details:
Job DetailsABOUT LITTLE SAINT
 Located in the heart of historic downtown Healdsburg, Little Saint is a vibrant meeting place where guests are invited to connect over food, music, art and conversation. Our mission is to create an environment that is good for the soul, the earth and the community. Inside our 10,000-square-foot space, Little Saint offers up a full-service farm-forward restaurant, cafe and wine shop with a focus on plant-based cuisine. The building is home to exciting live music and thought-provoking conversations, as well as a series of film screenings and performances to benefit local artists and our farming community.
 
SUMMARY OF POSITION
Reporting to the General Manager, the Host will welcome guests, and provide accurate wait times and escort customers to the dining and bar areas. A successful host will have excellent organizational skills and a passion for hospitality to ensure each guest has a positive dining experience from the moment they arrive until their departure. 
 
CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Create a warm and welcoming atmosphere to greet guests. 
Be a Little Saint brand ambassador and engage with guests in conversation.
Provide guests with menus and answer any initial questions.
Seat guests at tables or in waiting areas.
Assigning guests to tables they prefer, while keeping table rotation in mind so that servers receive the right number of customers.
Engaging with guests to ensure they're happy with food and service.
Respond to complaints and helping to resolve them.
Answer phone calls, take reservations and answer questions as needed.
Have a detailed knowledge of the menu. 
Help out with other positions in the restaurant as needed.
Providing great customer service.

 
IDEAL QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum 2 years of related food, beverage and/or service management experience in a fine dining atmosphere.
High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
Ability to provide top-notch customer service in a fast-paced environment.
A positive attitude and ability to work well under pressure with all restaurant staff.
Does high-quality work while unsupervised.
Able to work in a standing position for long periods of time.
Able to safely lift and easily maneuver trays of food when necessary.
Willing to follow instructions and ask questions for clarification if needed.
Able to handle money accurately and operate a point-of-sale system.
Excellent financial acumen, math skills and computer proficiency.
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to read, write, and speak English fluently
Must have the ability to work flexible hours based on business

 
COMPENSATION

Competitive Salary
Medical, Dental, Vision Plans
Paid Time Off - Including vacation, sick and mental health days
Employee Assistance Program - 8 free counseling sessions annually 
401(k) w/ company discretionary match
Referral bonus
Employee dining and wine discounts

 
THIS PERSON SHOULD STRIVE TO

Make a positive impact, taking responsibility and initiative to resolve issues, always clearly communicating with the leadership team and team members
Be decisive, taking the initiative to make things happen, anticipating issues, and developing contingency plans
Be an active listener, remaining present and open, providing verbal, non-verbal, and supportive feedback, and showing our respect and empathy to their team.
Be motivated and committed, approaching all tasks of all sizes with enthusiasm and seizing opportunities to learn new skills or knowledge in order to improve your performance
Be flexible, responding with urgency and positively to changing environments
Maintain team focus via cooperation and support to other team members in the pursuit of company and department goals
Be a role model to the team, embodying the values of the Little Saint management team. 

Each of the items listed is considered to be an essential function of the role. However, this list should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all the responsibilities of the position. Little Saint reserves the right to alter the duties of this role.
 
Little Saint is an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.
Little Saint is committed to hiring a diverse workforce, sustaining an inclusive culture, fostering an environment of continual improvement, and opportunities for growth and career development.

job_details:
Job Details
Job Title: Santa Clara Program ChefJob Status: Full-time ExemptSupervisor: Brigaid Regional ChefLocation: Santa Clara, CA Compensation: $85,000 plus full benefits
About Brigaid: Founded by former Noma head chef Dan Giusti, Brigaid is a startup that began challenging the school food status quo by putting professional chefs into public schools to cook fresh, wholesome food from scratch. In 2016, we launched our first pilot program with the New London Public School district in New London, Connecticut. Since then, we’ve partnered with several more school districts around the country and expanded our reach into institutional kitchens of all kinds, equipping chefs to work within the parameters of federally-funded food assistance programs to provide organizations with practical solutions and hands-on training that facilitate improved outcomes for those they serve. We encourage you to learn more about our work by visiting our website, chefsbrigaid.com, and our Instagram, @brigaid. 
About Position: Brigaid has partnered with the Santa Clara Unified School District (SCUSD), a diverse public school district that serves 15,300 students from the cities of Santa Clara, Sunnyvale, and San Jose, and operates 27 school kitchens for its 28 schools (two schools share a kitchen). Since 2017, the district has also maintained its own farm, and produce harvested from the farm is regularly featured on the menus and used for nutrition education, including rainbow carrots, romaine, cauliflower, blood oranges, squash, and herbs. 
At this point, Brigaid has assessed all 27 of the district’s school kitchens. SCUSD has now prioritized hiring a Program Chef to help the district full-time to improve the overall quality of food offerings, maximize the value of current infrastructure, and increase student satisfaction. The Program Chef will spearhead these tasks and serve as a long-term fixture in the district, working closely with both district leadership and kitchen teams on the ground. This individual will also be essential to training the kitchen teams on basic cooking techniques, measurements, food safety, and organization. 
This is a year-round, full-time position. 
Job Responsibilities:

Work with district kitchen teams to implement the protocols and best practices contained in the Brigaid training program. Your job will be to set the highest example in quality and food safety for district employees to uphold every day, then to reinforce these standards and continue to monitor progress and adherence. 
Interface with food service employees, managers, and supervisors from a wide variety of backgrounds in ways above and beyond a strict teaching capacity, including the possibility of engagement with the school and broader community. 
Independently plan, manage, and document visits to district kitchens, fill out daily chef journals for internal recordkeeping, and participate in regularly scheduled Zoom calls with the Brigaid HQ team to discuss progress. 
Assist with any job-related tasks, including, but not limited to, receiving and storage of food and supplies, kitchen setup and breakdown, recipe scaling, food preparation, packing, serving, cleaning, dishes, etc., recognizing that other duties not listed may be required as needed.
Follow all Brigaid/school district protocols and standards of conduct according to the Brigaid and school district employee handbooks. 
Adhere to all United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) and Department of Health (DOH) guidelines and regulations. 

Job Qualifications:

At least 5 years of professional cooking experience (high volume cooking experience is a plus, and savory experience preferred). 
At least 2 years in a kitchen supervisory role.


ServSafe Manager certified, or the ability to take a Brigaid-sponsored 8-hour ServSafe Manager course and pass the exam during the initial training period.
Strong understanding of good food safety practices.
Strong cooking ability, with understanding of all basic cooking techniques.
Strong leadership and teaching skills.
Ability to lead, direct, and inspire food service teams.
Ability to use high volume kitchen equipment.
Ability to follow recipes and use basic math to determine preparation quantities.
Good verbal and communication skills.
Well versed in USDA National School Lunch Program (NSLP) standards and regulations, or the ability to learn and adhere to these standards.
Basic computer literacy, including Microsoft and Google programs and Zoom.
Flexibility in accommodating emergencies or changes in schedule.
Ability to work well under pressure and coordinate tasks.
Ability to work well with others in a team environment.

Physical Requirements:

Ability to travel between various district school kitchens in a timely manner (and the possibility of carrying kitchen/culinary equipment during this travel).
Ability to lift and carry heavy objects up to 50 pounds.
Ability to walk around and stand for long periods of time.
Proof of a recent negative TB test prior to starting (sponsored by Brigaid if one is needed). 

To Apply:
To be considered, please submit a resume and complete the secondary application when prompted by Culinary Agents (it is a link to Brigaid's Bamboo hiring portal). This secondary application must be completed for your candidacy to be considered.
The first round of the hiring process will be a Zoom interview, after which qualified candidates will be invited to a three-hour in-person practical interview in Santa Clara, CA. To be considered, you must be able to attend this in-person interview and follow the COVID-19 protocols listed below. A travel stipend of $250 will be offered to each candidate living more than 120 miles away from Santa Clara, and all candidates participating in the practical interview will receive compensation for their time. Should the final candidate for this position need to move, Brigaid also offers a one time, lump sum of $5,000 in relocation assistance, which is paid as part of the first paycheck and is subject to tax. 
Due to the high volume of applicants, only qualified candidates will be contacted–no phone calls or emails, please. Brigaid is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, socio-economic status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, age, religion or creed, disability, or political or sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic under state or federal law.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities as defined by the ADA to perform the essential functions of the job.
Benefits:

100% company-paid health insurance - a gold level plan through Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield
100% company-paid dental insurance through Guardian
100% company-paid vision insurance through Guardian
100% company-paid short- and long-term care insurance through Guardian
10 days of paid vacation
14 paid federal holidays
6 days of paid sick leave
401k with 4% company match

COVID-19 Considerations:

The initial interview will be conducted virtually, and a mask may be required to be worn at the in-person interview. Depending on the requirements of specific partner organizations, we may ask that you provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination.

Job DetailsSPQR is seeking canidates for General Managment enhance our team. Qualified canidates for this position are well experienced and can demonstrate a proven track record of growth, fiscal responsibility and above all customer service. We offer generous benefits including:

Generous salary package with bonus potential
Full coverage of employee medical and dental insurance coverage
Research stipends
Wine education
Cell phone and dining allowances
PTO
Staff meals and discounts

SPQR is a Northern California restaurant inspired by Italian cuisine and wine. We are looking for someone that shares a passion for hospitality, hands-on service, and is capable of building and maintaining teams.The Restaurant General Manager's focus is leading the FOH team and administrative operations; positioning the business for growth; establishing and maintaining good procedures throughout the physical space and ensuring good administrative and training practices are followed. This position will work in recruiting new staff and refining the service team; achieving objectives in sales, costs, profitability, and guest service and satisfaction; through overseeing the day-to-day operations. A minimum of 5 years experience managing the floor of a fine dining restaurant is required. We are looking for canidates with a strong work ethic, who are results orientated, who are driven, accept personal responsibility and exude positive energy. Candidates must have a proven ability to build and inspire service teams and lead by example. No job is too small and no detail insignificant, someone who deeply cares about customer satisfaction and exudes hospitality. The ideal candidate will also possess a demonstrable interest and understanding of both food and wine, and who will excel in a fast paced, high-energy environment. Qualified Applicants must have:

5 years of fine dining restaurant management and adminstrative experience
Knowledge of employment regulations and laws
Knowledge and understanding of Restaurant Financials
Strong skills in guest and employee relations

Applicants should include a Cover Letter with resume indicating the following:

Overview of relevant experience and how it will pertain to SPQR
Overview of primary achievements in past positions
Explanation of Management Style and wine knowledge

SUMMARYUnder the general direction of the Service Director, the Front Door Attendant will greet guests as they enter the restaurant. They will also engage with guests to ensure their meal is as good as it should be. To do well in this role you should be comfortable standing for long periods and managing a very busy shift.ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Greets guests who arrive by welcoming them to the restaurant.
Opens restaurant doors for all guests.
Handles all guest interactions with the highest level of hospitality and professionalism, accommodating special requests whenever possible
Resolves customer complaints, assists customers in all inquiries
Creating and Distributing menus related to the guests experience 
Maintaining and stocking restrooms throughout service

QUALIFICATIONS FOR SUCCESS

Relevant hospitality and service experience
Commitment to quality, excellence, and genuine hospitality
Passion for creating unique guest experiences
Ability to provide warm, humble, and knowledgeable service
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
Strong task and time management abilities
Willingness to continue learning about food, beverage, and service
Willingness to work as part of an efficient team in a fast-paced environment
Polite and engaging
Neat and well-groomed appearance
Ability to work nights, weekends, extended hours, and holidays

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Ability to clearly speak, hear, see (i.e. distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus)
Ability to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 8 hours)
Ability to stand for long periods of time, walk, sit, reach, bend, stoop, climb, push/pull, and frequently lift up to 35 pounds and occasionally lift/move 50 pounds
Continual use of manual dexterity and gross motor skills with frequent use of bi-manual dexterity and fine motor skills

KEY COMPETENCIES

To have a positive impact, taking responsibility and initiative to resolve issues, always clearly communicating with leadership team and team members
To be decisive, accepting responsibility for making things happen, thinking ahead, and developing contingency plans
To be an active listener, remaining present and open, providing verbal, non-verbal, and supportive feedback, and showing our respect and empathy with one another.
To be motivated and committed, approaching all tasks with enthusiasm and seizing opportunities to learn new skills or knowledge in order to improve your performance
To be flexible, responding quickly and positively to changing environments
To maintain high team focus via cooperation and support to other team members in the pursuit of department goals
To be a positive role model and demonstrate the ethos of Kyle, Katina, and the management team

job_details:
Job Details
Newly renovated Embassy Suites by Hilton Marin County seeking experienced Catering Sales Manager! Very competitive wage plus Sales Incentive Bonus plan.
 
What you will be doing
Catering Sales Manager is responsible for generating top line revenue for the Embassy Suites by Hilton San Rafael by securing new accounts; maintain existing accounts and executing sales strategies to maximize the profitability of the hotel. As Catering Sales Manager, you would be responsible for executing written sales agreements for events by driving sales leads and increasing conversions, through these efforts and the successful execution of such events, in the hotel's continuing effort, to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability.
The Catering Sales Manager will interact frequently with guests and customers with the intention of earning repeat and expanded business. Specifically, you would be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:

Execute written sales agreements for all functions in the hotel's meeting space
Focus on a consistently executed up-selling approach
Participate in hotel promotional activities
Negotiate terms and pricing of vendor partner agreements and service agreements with companies and organizations affiliated meeting business
Maintain relationships among the customers their representatives and the hotel to ensure full participation in servicing accounts
Initiate verbal and written communication with customers and hotel departments outlining details and specifics of the event including, but not limited to, payment structure all food and beverage, public room rental, rental fees, incremental and affiliate revenue streams, performance damages and master billing process
Partner with operations departments and monitor and develop team member performance to include, but not limited to, providing supervision and professional development, conducting counseling and evaluations and delivering recognition and reward
Monitor and assess service and satisfaction trends, evaluate and address issues and make improvements accordingly

Essential Duties and Responsibilites:

Produce proposals, contracts, event orders and billing related correspondence
Conduct site inspections and handle social inquires as needed
Manage the sales process through consistent lead follow-up, attention to detail, building rapport and closing business
Effectively communicate client needs via Event Orders (BEOs) and event resumes in a timely fashion
Coordinate final details, but not limited to, menus, meeting arrangements, guarantees, event room set-up, audio-visual, d cor and coordinate with outside vendors
Assist with day-of event coordination acting as liaison between all departments within the hotel
Properly track sales activity and event data in Delphi
Adhere to food, beverage and room rental revenue minimums
Greet and assist clients with any needs and changes throughout events
Acts professionally and adheres to all service standards and guidelines
Follow up with client to assure quality of event and solicitation of next event
Interact with all levels of staff and management and attend in-house meetings as needed
Ability to meet and work effectively under time and resource constraints.
Ability to investigate and analyze current activities or information in the sales/marketing field and make logical conclusions and recommendations.
Ability to make decisions based on established policies and procedures.
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends and holidays as needed
Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.
Pushing, pulling, bending, stooping, upward reaching
Prolonged periods of standing and walking
Able to lift a minimum of 25 lbs.

Required Skills & Experience

Two (2) Years of Conference/Convention Services Experience in a related position with this company and/or another organization, Required.
Previous Hilton Brand Experience, Highly Preferred.
Hotel Catering Sales Experience, Highly Preferred.
Delphi FDC Certification, Preferred.

Additional Qualification:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Able to communicate with clients in a friendly and positive manner in order to solicit business, meet client needs and resolve complaints.
Able to read, listen and communicate effectively in English, both verbally and in writing.
Ability perform intermediate to expert functions in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
Strong attention to detail
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
Ability to access, understand and accurately input information using a moderately complex computer system.
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, percentages and sales volume.
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Ability to write routine Sales Reports and business correspondence.
Meets legal age requirements for the position.

job_details:
Job Details
Upscale/Casual Peruvian Nikkei Restaurant Hiring all BOH StaffDo you enjoy creating special experiences for others? Are you looking to join a family of tight knit and motivated people who support each other? Then you would probably excel on our team!We are Kaiyō Union St. and Kaiyō Rooftop Lounge - Peruvian Nikkei cuisine and cocktails with multiple locations if SF.We are in search of Line Cooks to join our team and elevate our culinary program. If you have a passion for food attention to detail, at least 2 years experience in a kitchen and want to join a fun and exciting program then we have a spot for you.Must be available evenings and weekends!!A line cook is a skilled culinary professional who works in a restaurant or other food service establishment. The primary responsibility of a line cook is to prepare food to order and ensure that all dishes are of the highest quality and meet the restaurant's standards. Some of the specific duties and responsibilities of a line cook include:

Preparing and cooking food: A line cook is responsible for cooking and preparing a variety of dishes according to the restaurant's recipes and guidelines.
Organizing and stocking ingredients: Line cooks are responsible for ensuring that all ingredients and necessary supplies are readily available and well-stocked.
Maintaining cleanliness: Line cooks must maintain a clean and safe work environment, including cleaning and sanitizing all cooking surfaces and equipment.
Collaborating with other team members: Line cooks must work closely with other kitchen staff, including sous chefs, chefs, and other line cooks, to ensure that all orders are prepared and served in a timely manner.
Following food safety guidelines: Line cooks must follow all food safety guidelines and regulations, including ensuring that food is cooked to the proper temperature and stored appropriately.
Managing inventory: Line cooks are responsible for keeping track of inventory levels, and informing management when supplies need to be reordered.
Learning new recipes and techniques: Line cooks must stay up-to-date with new recipes and cooking techniques, and be willing to learn new skills to improve their abilities in the kitchen.

Overall, a line cook plays a critical role in the day-to-day operations of a restaurant, and must be highly skilled, efficient, and knowledgeable about cooking and food preparation.

job_details:
Job DetailsAwarded 1 Michelin Star in the 2022 California Guide, Osito opened in late December 2021, Chef Stowaway’s inaugural restaurant. It is San Francisco’s only 100 percent live fire, fine dining experience, located in the heart of the Mission District. More than just a restaurant, Osito is a community of makers, farmers and supporters who have brought the Osito concept to life in the middle of a global pandemic with a philosophy to create an experience that is special and memorable, as well as accessible and inviting. The Osito experience is intimate – a place where strangers become friends in a warm setting, with a menu comprised of the most beautiful ingredients of the day. The beverage program is rounded out by an extensive wine selection with a focus on natural and biodynamic production, with carefully selected sakes, ciders and beers. The menu is inspired by collective memories and moments of nostalgia from Seth's past growing up in south Texas and his experience cooking on the California coast.
We are seeking spirited individuals who thrive in an environment that is progressive and continuous with education in areas of service, food, and wine.  We lead with positive reinforcement and encourage each individual to create their own pathways to personal growth, with the support and guidance of our team.  We celebrate diversity, authenticity, and individuality, and are dedicated to creating a culture that is inclusive of all employees. We highly encourage BIPOC and LGBTQ + to apply. Please send us your resume and cover letter to be considered. Thank you!
Osito is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to considering all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.
Job Description
Osito Captains should have passion for Food & Beverage and guest satisfaction. Cattains should be very detail oriented, efficient, and open to learning and suggestions. Your job requires you to be prompt, reliable, and always carry a gracious and hospitable attitude. A successful candidate is both a self-starter and works well collaborating with a team. Osito strives to be a place for people to learn and grow in their careers.
Duties and Responsibilities -Provide a high level of service and hospitality to guests while staying true to the Osito culture -Contribute and elevate service with a strong dedication to detail -Work closely with kitchen staff to have a full understanding of our menu  -Work closely with the Wine Director to have a thorough understanding of the wine and beverage program -Create discourse with guests to establish trust to guide them through the Osito dining experience -Stay current on changes to the wine program on a day-to-day basis -Execute graceful tableside presentation and be knowledgeable about different styles of service -Full knowledge of the Osito Food Menu, Cocktail menu, and Wine By the Glass offerings -Being able to control a station, guiding and orchestrating all steps in the sequence of service including table maintenance, marking, clearing, running food, explaining each course, assisting with wine pairings and wine service, resetting tables, water service and as further outlined in the service manual -Complete all opening / closing sidework as outlined in daily sidework sheets -Communicate with guests and coworkers in a respectful, precise manner  -Provide all auxiliary beverage service including coffee, tea, and non-alcoholic beverages -Understand all aspects of service and be a role model for other members of the Staff -Maintain an gracious and professional manner on the floor at all times -Understand our guests and be able to provide them with the experience they desire within the scope of our restaurant -Ensure clean and polished glassware, silverware and plates are available as needed  -Communicate with Service Assistants to ensure proper glassware and silverware are set for each course -Keep service station clean and clear of clutter (notes, used service items, etc.) -Ensure guests receive parting gifts (menus, tote bags, etc.) -Communicate with Host to learn guests' special needs (VIPs, allergies, wine pairings, etc.)   Qualifications -Knowledge of hospitality and fine points of service (open handed, synchronization, etc.)  -Two years of experience in a similar restaurant environment preferred -Posses a hospitable and gracious demeanor -Strong knowledge of Food & Beverage -Food Handler’s Safety Permit, ABC RBS training certification -US work authorization required -Ability to occasionally lift up to 50 pounds

job_details:
Job DetailsRockridge’s ACRE Hiring Head Bartender,

Be part of our team! Rockridge’s most anticipated new restaurant, ACRE, is currently hiring at 5655 College Avenue, Oakland for a range of positions.
About ACRE: 
Chef and Owner Dirk Tolsma and Managing Partner Pete Sittnick are opening ACRE located in the heart of Oakland’s Rockridge neighborhood in the popular Market Hall building.  Occupying the former longtime home of Oliveto, ACRE will honor the rich culinary history of the space with an ingredient-driven menu of California/Mediterranean cuisine served in an updated setting with a welcoming, neighborhood approachability. Slated to open this fall, ACRE is something of a homecoming for Tolsma.  After working his way through the North Bay (Barrel House Tavern in Sausalito, Eloise Restaurant in Sebastopol) as well as San Francisco favorites like Baker and Banker, Tolsma is excited to return to his family’s East Bay roots.  Tolsma and Sittnick first connected at EPIC Steak, where Tolsma served as the chef de cuisine with Sittnick as the managing partner. 
Located in the heart of Oakland’s Rockridge neighborhood in the popular Market Hall building, ACRE Restaurant is the creation of industry veterans Executive Chef Dirk Tolsma and Managing Partner Pete Sittnick. Slated to open Fall 2022, ACRE will be a community gathering space with casual offerings in the first floor Café and approachable, locally sourced, California-inspired cuisine in the upstairs dining room. ACRE will feature an ingredient-driven menu of California/Mediterranean-inspired cuisine that showcases local farms, all in a welcoming environment.
We ask all of our team members to participate in knowledgeable and respectful communication with guests and each other, coming to work with a desire to learn and work together. Each position in our team requires teamwork, a flexible schedule, an ability to stay calm within a busy environment, and the ability to multitask and stay organized.

We are seeking inspired, outgoing individuals to get involved with our operations. Preferred applicants will have a curiosity for food sourcing and a foundational knowledge around local produce and wine. Relevant experience with fast paced, high quality service environments where attention to detail and ability to work at a fast pace is a must.

We are currently seeking the following candidatesFor 

Bartenders


Compensation: 

Competitive Wages
Employer-sponsored (subsidized) health insurance
Shift Meal

job_details:
Job Details
Jordan Winery, an iconic producer of French-inspired wines in Sonoma County, is seeking a highly motivated individual to join our team. While we don't have a typical tasting room, responsibilities include exceeding hospitality standards to provide guests with an unforgettable experience. The Estate Server will work closely with the event team and take their guidance to achieve high quality service standards as described in our service operating procedures.
At Jordan, we offer a welcoming workplace, a culture of excellence where quality performance is rewarded and a commitment to use proceeds from wine sales to help those less fortunate. If you share our values, have a passion for hospitality and love food and wine, we would like you to apply to join the family. This position is on-call, part-time and based at the winery in Healdsburg, California.
Summary
We host a variety of consumer, trade and media experiences and events at the winery. Events and experiences can range from large events to private dinners to multi-course tasting menu experiences. We provide noteworthy hospitality to our guests from the moment they arrive at the Chateau. Our primary goal is to create memorable experiences for our guests for years to come.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Attend the daily pre-shift meeting to learn any important event details and service flow, and attend any other scheduled staff meetings
Complete all assigned pre-shift side duties in a timely manner
Serve food in a composed, elegant approach according to Jordan
Must have explicit knowledge of the menu for the event
Participate and ensure compliance with all opening and closing duties as needed
Monitor and observe guests' dining experiences
Keep the chefs and managers informed of any issues that might affect quality or timing of service
Support Guest Service Associates in exceeding guests’ expectations

Estate Server Minimum Qualifications and Requirements:

At least two years as server, captain, or sommelier is preferred
Food, Wine and Spirits knowledge is a plus
Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds and work on your feet for multiple hours
Open availability including weekends is ideal
Strong desire to contribute and elevate service and hospitality standards
Attention to detail is a must especially during a fast-paced service
Positive outlook and forward-thinking mentality
Excited to provide guests with a premier high-luxury experience
A willingness to learn and grow
Able to communicate verbally in an articulate manner
A valid California Food Handler certificate must be completed before the shift begins
A valid Responsible Beverage Serving (RBS) certificate must be completed before the shift begins
Must be at least 18 years of age
Must have reliable transportation to work

There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com. © 2022 Nordstrom, Inc  Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.Pay Range DetailsThe pay range(s) below are provided in compliance with state specific laws. Pay ranges may be different in other locations.California: $18.70-$19.45 hourly

job_details:
Job DetailsOur team is expanding to support our growing portfolio and are excited to welcome an addition to our Hospitality Wine Educator team.  As an Educator, you will provide a personalized and instructional experience for our tasting room guests.   
You will be successful in this role while performing these essential responsibilities:

Build new and retain existing ambassadors through customer engagement, customer follow-up and by providing outstanding customer service with all customer interactions. 
Achieve or exceed department goals by utilizing strategic selling skills to encourage membership and through assisting customers with purchases. 
Conduct informative tasting experiences including guided tours with ability to display and convey knowledge of wine and the stories of our wineries. 
Ability to speak confidently and with accuracy in front of large groups. 
The ability to facilitate and close sales transactions.
Assist with the set-up and execution of special events as requested.

Our organizational culture is built upon a strong foundation of shared commitments: 

Takes ownership of job responsibilities through focus, determination, and attention to detail. Works to elevate the performance of their team.
Works as a member of a highly functioning team. Maintains professional and respectful dialogue with peers to collaboratively identify positive outcome.  Communicates regularly and provides support and mentorship. 
Displays trust in their actions, having the confidence to know that we are all working for the benefit of each other.
Creates an environment where their team is encouraged to brings forward ideas for improvement and ways to increase efficiency. Is personally open to new ideas, respectful debate and positive change.
Strives to elevate their performance and that of their team. Is nimble to the changing needs and priorities of the organization. 
Represents the organization professionally through effective communication and follow through. Serves as a role model for their peers and colleagues, values difference and strives for understanding.
Shows care and responsibility for the resources that have been provided to them and aids in our efforts for social responsibility and being environmentally conscious.
Demonstrates integrity, honesty, and fairness in their interactions, working towards achieving personal achievement rather than public attention.
Assists their team in achieving the best outcomes. Demonstrates pride and provides relevant expectations and accountability.

We offer a supportive salary and generous benefit package to include three weeks of paid time off annually, company matching and profit sharing through our retirement savings account and we pay a large percentage of your medical, dental and vision insurance. Tuition reimbursement, industry discounts and more!
You will be qualified for this role if you met these requirements: 

Two years of previous similar work experience
Proven computer literacy and familiarity with Microsoft office
High attention to detail and superior customer service skills
Goal oriented and able to work as part of a team.

Some physical requirements, our large estate requires: 

Ability to walk on uneven surfaces
Ability to lift up to 40 lbs.
Ability to ascend and descend stairs

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.
comp_details: Compensation DetailsCompensation: Hourly ($21.00 - $30.00) plus tipsBenefits & Perks: Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Paid Time Off, 401k, Commuter Benefits, Wellness Program

job_details:
Job Details
We are seeking a skilled Cook to prepare delicious meals according to our menu. You will cook dishes that aim to delight in a timely manner.
We expect that you will follow instructions in cooking and delivering well-prepared meals. You must be able to move around the kitchen and multi-task. Experience in using various ingredients and cooking techniques is a must.
Responsibilities

Set up workstations with all needed ingredients and cooking equipment
Prepare ingredients to use in cooking (chopping and peeling vegetables, cutting meat etc.)
Cook food with various utensils or grillers
Check food while cooking
Keep a sanitized and orderly environment in the kitchen
Ensure all food and other items are stored properly
Check quality of ingredients
Monitor stock and place orders when there are shortages

Requirements

Proven experience as cook
Experience in using cutting tools, cookware and bakeware
Knowledge of various cooking procedures and methods (grilling, baking, boiling etc.)
Ability to follow all sanitation procedures
Ability to work in a team
Very good communication skills
comp_details: Compensation DetailsCompensation: Hourly ($19.00 - $21.00) plus tipsBenefits & Perks: One free meal per working shift

job_details: Job DetailsAbout the Position:Candidates should be outgoing, positive and have a strong background in hospitality and full service restaurants, as well as a passion for learning and growth. We are seeking a candidate that has knowledge of, and a desire to learn more about Italian cuisine. They should provide exceptional guest experiences and continually strive to exceed guests expectations with every opportunity.We are looking for a strong leader in the kitchen who can provide guidance and coaching to our kitchen team. The Sous Chef role will be responsible for leading line ups, providing support in the kitchen during service, upholding and elevating our service standards, providing strong communication with the dining room and private events team.Outside of service responsibilities will include weekly manager meetings, financial oversight, scheduling, and work towards cultivating a healthy team dynamic.We source products from many extraordinary local farms whom we have direct relationships with and will work to expand your product knowledge base - our team visits three bay area markets every week to source the best product possible. We offer interdepartmental education opportunities throughout the restaurant allowing our team members to grow their skill base.We provide a safe and positive working environment where you can grow as a cook and a manager. This is a kitchen that promotes a healthy and balanced lifestyle.Che Fico offers highly competitive pay, two weeks paid vacation, paid paternal/maternal leave, multiple options for Health Care, dental and vision insurance, access to mental health services, 401k with 4% match. After one year, employees have access to our quarterly profit sharing pool.Management experience is a plus, however we will gladly accept applicants with a strong background in the service industry who are excited to take on a new role. We are growing quickly as a company, and seeking individuals who would like to grow with us.We highly encourage people of all backgrounds with varied experience levels to apply. We value and seek diversity amongst our team.Relocation financial support is possible for the right candidate.About Che Fico Alimentari:Che Fico Alimentari is an extension of Che Fico, with traditional cuisine influenced by the wine bars and trattorias of Italy. Our chefs were inspired by a particular trip to Rome, and aim to bring both the Roman cuisine and atmosphere to San Francisco. Che Fico Alimentari’s menu features more traditional fare - house made salumi, antipasti, classic pasta dishes, local and imported cheeses. We also have a robust pantry program, featuring housemade sauces and spreads, dried pasta and cured meat. We’re striving to transport the Italian experience of stopping in to your favorite neighborhood shop for snacks, wine and dried pasta to bring home.Press:Bon Appétithttp://projects.bonappetit.com/hot10/p/1New York Timeshttps://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/25/travel/che-fico-restaurant-san-francisco-review.htmlSF Chroniclehttps://www.sfchronicle.com/restaurants/diningout/article/Che-Fico-12977186.phpWashington Posthttps://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/food/san-franciscos-hottest-restaurant-is-in-an-old-auto-body-shop/2018/08/16/bf4cc92a-9cba-11e8-b60b-1c897f17e185_story.html?noredirect=on

job_details:
Job DetailsAbout our Brand
More than a group of hotels, The LINE is a creative community built around a sense of discovery — an exploration of a building, a neighborhood, and a culture. From Koreatown in LA to Adams Morgan in DC to downtown Austin, each property is architecturally interesting and chosen for its location in emerging neighborhoods in compelling cities.  LINE hotels are both reflective and responsive— shaped by the communities they are part of while also contributing something new to those places. LINE properties are a collaboration of the best local and out-of-town talent in design, food and beverage, arts and culture.Position: Restaurant Sous Chef
Location: The LINE San Francisco
Full Time – San Francisco, CA
Job Overview
The main responsibility is the oversight of the operations of each menu, in close coordination with the CDC and Executive Chef. The Sous Chef assumes responsibilities of the Executive Chef or CDC if they are unavailable.
Excellent communication is necessary to be an intermediary between the kitchen and management. Strong leadership and a positive mindset are needed to maintain a good kitchen culture.
The Sous Chef must possess good communication skills, have the ability to resolve conflict and have a thorough understanding of LINE policies, procedures and expectations. 
Opened in Fall of 2022, the LINE SF is a kinetic intersection where SoMa, Union Square, and the Tenderloin converge. Our endeavor is to reflect the neighborhood, culture, and spirit of the city by offering a food and beverage program devoted to the bountiful ingredients offered in the Bay Area region.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities

Be always professional and courteous
Assist the CDC in operating a smooth-running kitchen on a day-to-day basis
Understand and nurture the F&B program’s concepts and culture
Collaborate with the CDC on training, guiding, managing and scheduling personnel
Maintain and coach high expectations for cleanliness, organization, food storage, and sanitation standards
Track product yield and recipe adherence for quality control and ordering purposes
Be familiar with all safety and emergency procedures including OSHA requirements
Ensure food preparation practices and areas meet health and safety standards
Establish and maintain good communication and teamwork with fellow colleagues and other departments within the hotel
Ensure health and safety standards are met to maintain safe food preparation practices and areas

Reporting Relationships
Reports directly to: Executive Chef
Also works closely with the Director of F&B
Directly supervises: Back of House Staff
Knowledge, Requirements and Skills

Experience in high volume dining preferred
At least three (2) years’ experience in the hospitality industry
Ability to use MS Office and F&B software systems (i.e. POS and F&B procurement system)
Must be aware of management functions and can communicate with all levels of personnel and customers
Excellent reading, writing and oral proficiency in the English Language        
Excellent organizational and time management skills, attention to detail
Ability to multitask
Work well under pressure, requires being a team player

Compensation & Benefits
We offer competitive wages and benefits while fostering a diverse and inclusive work experience.  We thrive in being a diverse work environment. Consideration for employment will be based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic as established by law.
We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
comp_details: Compensation DetailsCompensation: Salary ($65,000.00 - $75,000.00)Benefits & Perks: Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Paid Time Off, 401k, Commuter Benefits, Potential Bonuses, Dining Discounts

role_name: Director of Pastry and Bakery Operations
job_details:
Job Details
Our Needs
We are a growing, California based, multi-unit restaurant, market and bakery concept, with an organic artisanal wholesale bakery.  We are currently seeking a motivated Director of Pastry & Bakery Operations (“DOPB”) with experience in high volume bakeries, specializing in Viennoiserie and pastries.  

The DOPB position will be based in Los Angeles, with occasional travel to Farmshop’s Northern California location.  The DOPB will oversee and coordinate the planning, organizing, training and provide leadership necessary to achieve our stated objectives in sales, purchasing, employee retention, customer service and satisfaction, food quality, cleanliness and sanitation.  Furthermore, the DOPB will be directly involved with our research and development projects, including consumer packaged goods (CPG) developed from our current artisanal product line, as well as Farmshop’s retail and commercial applications. 

In addition to the Culver City production facility, we are currently under development at another facility in Downtown Los Angeles that will act as a classroom and  incubator for Farmshop’s consumer packaged goods (CPG) in our soon-to-be product development test kitchen. 

Who We Are

Farmshop celebrates farmers and artisan producers who are behind all that we create.  Farmshop was founded in 2010 by Chef-Owner Jeff Cerciello, former Culinary Director for the Thomas Keller Restaurant Group.  The first Farmshop restaurant opened at The Brentwood Country Mart in 2010, a second location opened in Northern California at the Marin Country Mart in 2013, 

In 2016, to meet the growing demand of our baked goods, Farmshop launched a wholesale bakery in Culver City.  WIth our continual commitment to sourcing the best ingredients, both local and organic, this dedication made Farmshop’s incremental growth both possible and exciting along the journey.  Within six years from the opening of the wholesale bakery, Farmshop’s wholesale customers grew to over 230 accounts. In the fall of 2021, Farmshop launched an Artisanal Breads line, headed by Peter Resch to much adoration. Within less than a year of its launch, Farmshop’s bread production grew to over 1,000 loaves per day with placements in over 50 locations, including  twenty-five Trader Joe’s grocery stores in Southern California.
Tools for the Director of Pastry & Bakery Operations Position

A genuine passion and overall knowledge of  pastries & baking 
Culinary school attendance
Extensive experience with laminated doughs 
Extensive and broad working knowledge of commercial bakery equipment
Production experience including work flow and cycles
Candidates must have a proven track record of success in a deadline-driven, fast-paced environment with a demonstrated ability to provide exceptional sales support and customer service while also showing the ability to lead and work independently
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills
Financial acumen commensurate with business management
High level presentation skills; able to present ideas in a way that produces understanding and impact
Able to exercise good judgment in determining workflow, priorities, and deadlines
High School Diploma or equivalent; Bachelor’s Degree is preferred
Minimum of 1-2 years of guest relations and/or sales experience
Some working knowledge of CRM (Customer Relationship Management)  technology
Must be available to maintain schedule appropriate with customer’s business operations and travel as needed during the weekly work schedule

Compensation

Salary Range:  $120k - $175k, depending on experience
Paid Vacation - 80 hours annually
Medical Benefits - Medical, Dental, Vision
Relocation Assistance


More To Explore 
Our Website 

https://farmshopca.com/

Follow Us on Instagram

https://www.instagram.com/farmshopca/?hl=e

job_details: Job DetailsAdditional Information On callJob Number 23026378Job Category Food and Beverage & CulinaryLocation Monterey Marriott, 350 Calle Principal, Monterey, California, United States VIEW ON MAPSchedule Part-TimeLocated Remotely? NRelocation? NPosition Type Non-Management JOB SUMMARY   Our jobs aren’t just about serving guests during a banquet or event. Instead, we want to build an experience that is memorable and unique. Our Guest Event Experts are skilled in a wide range of event functions with responsibility for making sure the event is well-executed from start to finish. Whether setting up or breaking down the materials, transporting supplies, taking orders, interacting with guests, or anything in between, the Guest Event Expert makes transactions feel like part of the experience.   No matter what position you are in, there are a few things that are critical to success – creating a safe work place, following company policies and procedures, upholding quality standards, and ensuring your uniform, personal appearance, and communications are professional. Guest Service Experts will be on their feet and moving around (stand, sit, or walk for an extended time) and taking a hands-on approach to work (move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 25 pounds without assistance). Doing all these things well (and other reasonable job duties as requested) is critical for Guest Event Experts – to get it right for our guests and our business each and every time.    The pay range for this position is $15.50 to $15.50 per hour and may offer 401(k) plan, earned paid time off and/or sick leave, and other wellness benefits. Benefits may be subject to generally applicable eligibility, waiting period, contribution, and other requirements and conditions.    Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law. Marriott International considers for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Marriott International portfolio of brands includes both JW Marriott and Marriott Hotels.  Marriott Hotels, Marriott International’s flagship brand with more than 500 global locations, is advancing the art of hosting so that our guests can travel brilliantly. As a host with Marriott Hotels, you will help keep this promise by delivering premium choices, sophisticated style, and well-crafted details. With your skills and imagination, together we will innovate and reinvent the future of travel.      JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 80 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. JW believes our associates come first. Because if you’re happy, our guests will be happy. It’s as simple as that. Our hotels offer a work experience unlike any other, where you’ll be part of a community and enjoy a true camaraderie with a diverse group of co-workers. JW creates opportunities for training, development, recognition and most importantly, a place where you can really pursue your passions in a luxury environment. Treating guests exceptionally starts with the way we take care of our associates. That’s The JW Treatment™.

Job DetailsCompany Overview:
Proper Hospitality is an international hospitality company that designs, brands and operates bespoke properties and experiences. Our eponymously-named Proper Hotels are located in emerging urban innovation districts within the most exciting U.S. cities, including San Francisco, Los Angeles, Palm Springs, and Austin. Each Proper Hotel is a unique reflection of the vibrant community around it, and shares the same excellence in service, convenience of location, and world-class amenities provided by its local networks of co-conspirators – innovators in food, beverage, technology, art, music, fashion and wellness.
Proper Hospitality is made up of a diverse group of passionate individuals who share a common love for hotels and the art of hospitality. Our philosophy is simple: There is a right way to do things and anything less just isn’t proper. We are seeking out the “best of the best” from inside and outside of the industry to work alongside us as we grow a new kind of lifestyle Hospitality Company inspired by a centuries-old tradition. The work is challenging and fast-paced, but rewarding above all.
What follows is a general overview of some of the qualifications for, and duties associated with, this position, and certain expectations regarding job performance. This is not a comprehensive job description, and it does not identify all essential job functions or duties associated with this position.
